data.title: CityUHK team creates 3D-printed smart materials inspired by sea urchin spines, led by Prof. Lu Jian.
data.description: On March 1, 2026, in Hong Kong, a study overseen by Professor Lu Jian of City University of Hong Kong revealed a significant finding related to a porous ceramic material. Professor Lu Jian, serving as the Dean of the College of Engineering and a Chair Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at CityUHK, led the research team. This discovery has the potential to revolutionize the field due to the intrinsic properties of the porous ceramic material.

data.title: Caribbean scientist Michael A. Taylor discusses urgent climate resilience roadmap for Caribbean on Planet Classroom Network.
data.description: In a recent episode of Net Zero Speaks, important strategies for enhancing climate resilience in the Caribbean were discussed. The episode, hosted by the Planet Classroom Network in collaboration with the Protect Our Planet (POP) Movement, focused on addressing heat, flooding, and coastal storm risks in the region. This information is particularly crucial given the increasing frequency of climate-related events in the Caribbean. Viewers were presented with a comprehensive roadmap to tackle these challenges, emphasizing the need for immediate action. The episode, released in New York on March 1, 2026, provides valuable insights and guidance to safeguard the Caribbean from climate threats.

data.title: Ericsson joins OCUDU Ecosystem Foundation to advance open-source CU/DU, U.S. wireless innovation.
data.description: As a founding premier member, Ericsson has recently partnered with the OCUDU Ecosystem Foundation, operating under the Linux Foundation. This collaboration aims to drive the progress of open-source CU/DU and wireless innovation in the U.S. Ericsson, known for its expertise in technology, will provide essential architectural advice, promote technology neutrality, and aid in establishing an open and interoperable RAN within the industry. The active involvement of Ericsson will be crucial in shaping the future of wireless technology, as the company contributes to the advancement of key industry standards and practices.
